programme.desc: Deed is approached by a woman, Mrs Hussein, who claims that her entire family was wiped out in Iraq by the depleted uranium used by the British in their tank shells. Mrs Hussein has painstakingly gathered her evidence, but until she speaks to Deed, has trouble finding anyone to represent her. Despite problems in their friendship, and her approaching wedding, Deed persuades Jo Mills to take on Mrs Hussein's case. Meanwhile Deed presides over a case brought by Mrs Bridges, a victim of motor neurone disease, who claims that her terrible illness was caused by the installation of a mobile phone mast on top of her apartment block. programme.desc: Arguably the first Supergroup, Cream with Disraeli Gears in 1967, achieved massive worldwide success and ensured their place in rocks hall of fame. programme.title: Classic Albums

programme.desc: They said it would never happen. Cream were one of the best-loved bands of the late 60s, a unique blend of psychedelia, blues, jazz, blues and pop, they lasted little more than two years and 4 studio albums, including the legendary 'Disraeli Gears', and split up after a farewell gig at the Royal Albert Hall in November 1968. Eric Clapton went on to become rock royalty both here and abroad. Bassist Jack Bruce and drummer Ginger Baker have had interesting and varied careers without achieving Eric's commercial success.
programme.title: Cream Reunion at the Royal Albert Hall

programme.desc: Arguably the first Supergroup, Cream with Disraeli Gears in 1967, achieved massive worldwide success and ensured their place in rocks hall of fame. Disraeli Gears has long been regarded as a classic, transforming Cream from visionary blues based revivalists to psychedelic pop / rock heroes and was a pivotal moment in the development of Heavy Rock.
programme.title: Classic Albums

programme.desc: They said it would never happen. Cream were one of the best-loved bands of the late 60s, a unique blend of psychedelia, blues, jazz, blues and pop, they lasted little more than two years and 4 studio albums, including the legendary 'Disraeli Gears', and split up after a farewell gig at the Royal Albert Hall in November 1968. Eric Clapton went on to become rock royalty both here and abroad. Bassist Jack Bruce and drummer Ginger Baker have had interesting and varied careers without achieving Eric's commercial success.
programme.title: Cream Reunion at the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: Film 2006 with Jonathan Ross

programme.desc: At Meercat Mountain what will happen when the mongoose meet the meercats? Lord Bath goes back to the floor as a rhino keeper for the day and the head of Pets Corner gets locked in with the lions. More tales from Longleat House and Safari Park with Ben Fogle and Kate Humble. [S]
programme.title: Animal Park

programme.desc: Holmes and Watson are asked to escort Lady Carstairs and her precious "Star of Rhodesia" diamond from Euston to Edinburgh. Shortly into the train journey her son is murdered and the diamond stolen. [b&w]

programme.title: Monk

programme.desc: Review of the papers with wit and insight.
programme.title: What the Papers Say

programme.desc: Paul Martin gathers another crowd eager to have their antiques and collectables examined for sale potential in Derby. Experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott have their knowledge put to the test with another wide range of objects wrapped in old newspaper.
programme.title: Flog It!

programme.subtitle: Culloden
programme.desc: Over 250 years ago Bonnie Prince Charlie triggered the last land battle in Britain. In this episode father and son presenters, Peter and Dan Snow, follow his tracks as he marched an army from Scotland all the way to Derby and was then chased back for the final confrontation on Culloden Moor. As Peter reveals how close Prince Charles came to victory with the help of cutting-edge graphics, Dan goes on a night march and sees how, without the aid of modern technology, the troops of Bonnie Prince Charlie made a fatal error on the eve of the battle.
programme.title: Battlefield Britain

programme.desc: Eternity In the final episode of the series, Peter Ackroyd summons the ghosts of the Romantics in a story of drugs, sex and death.

programme.desc: Adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's thriller about a bi-sexual sociopathic murderer.
programme.title: The Talented Mr Ripley

programme.desc: Continuing from the 1971 series featuring the sit-down Irish stand-up in a barrage of short sketches and jokes.
programme.title: Dave Allen at Large

programme.desc: Another edition of the topical comedy show, hosted by Ireland's top comic Dara O'Briain. He is joined by regulars Rory Bremner, Hugh Dennis and Frankie Boyle, as well as Peep Show star David Mitchell.
programme.title: Mock the Week

programme.desc: Daryl Chase, a Harvard educated investment banker, finds that he just can't get rid of Freddy Tiffany, a street smart hustler, who for some reason thinks that they are friends. But Daryl's life is in danger when he discovers that his firm is involved in money laundering for a Mexican drug lord. Trying to escape being murdered and being captured by the FBI and CIA, Daryl swaps identities with Freddy but then discovers that his troubles are only just beginning. Directed by George Gallo. [S]

programme.desc: The UK is now home to a new breed of property entrepreneur.

programme.desc: With this week's Academy Award nominations in mind, Jonathan Ross reviews 'Walk the Line', the screen biography of Johnny Cash which is widely expected to earn recognition for Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon. Plus Charlize Theron, an Oscar winner for 'Monster', in her latest drama 'North Country', and a look at the qualities which make a film an Academy Award contender. [S]
programme.title: Film 2006 with Jonathan Ross

programme.desc: At Meercat Mountain what will happen when the mongoose meet the meercats? Lord Bath goes back to the floor as a rhino keeper for the day and the head of Pets Corner gets locked in with the lions. More tales from Longleat House and Safari Park with Ben Fogle and Kate Humble. [S]
programme.title: Animal Park

programme.desc: Holmes and Watson are asked to escort Lady Carstairs and her precious "Star of Rhodesia" diamond from Euston to Edinburgh. Shortly into the train journey her son is murdered and the diamond stolen. [b&w]
programme.title: Sherlock Holmes

programme.desc: When Natalie runs for school board, Monk must figure out who's behind an attempt on her life.
programme.title: Monk

programme.desc: Classic Hitchcock thriller, based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, author of The Talented Mr Ripley
programme.title: Strangers on a Train

programme.desc: Review of the papers with wit and insight.
programme.title: What the Papers Say

programme.desc: South American Raquel De Mendez comes from the same town as legendary footballer Pele. She shares with us the secret ingredients that go into a classic Brazilian feast. Whilst Dominic from Italy challenges his friend Arturus from Lithuania to a cooking competition - Eurovision style. [S]
programme.title: Dinner Next Door

programme.desc: Features John Prine who is one of the most influential songwriters from US. Also, Caoimhín Vallely offers a unique performance and harpist Laoise Kelly is joined by Steve Cooney. Pure magic.
programme.title: An Stuif Ceart

programme.subtitle: Culloden
programme.desc: Over 250 years ago Bonnie Prince Charlie triggered the last land battle in Britain. In this episode father and son presenters, Peter and Dan Snow, follow his tracks as he marched an army from Scotland all the way to Derby and was then chased back for the final confrontation on Culloden Moor. As Peter reveals how close Prince Charles came to victory with the help of cutting-edge graphics, Dan goes on a night march and sees how, without the aid of modern technology, the troops of Bonnie Prince Charlie made a fatal error on the eve of the battle.
programme.title: Battlefield Britain

programme.desc: Eternity In the final episode of the series, Peter Ackroyd summons the ghosts of the Romantics in a story of drugs, sex and death.
programme.title: The Romantics

programme.desc: Adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's thriller about a bi-sexual sociopathic murderer.
programme.title: The Talented Mr Ripley

programme.desc: Continuing from the 1971 series featuring the sit-down Irish stand-up in a barrage of short sketches and jokes.
programme.title: Dave Allen at Large

programme.desc: Another edition of the topical comedy show, hosted by Ireland's top comic Dara O'Briain. He is joined by regulars Rory Bremner, Hugh Dennis and Frankie Boyle, as well as Peep Show star David Mitchell.
programme.title: Mock the Week

programme.desc: Daryl Chase, a Harvard educated investment banker, finds that he just can't get rid of Freddy Tiffany, a street smart hustler, who for some reason thinks that they are friends. But Daryl's life is in danger when he discovers that his firm is involved in money laundering for a Mexican drug lord. Trying to escape being murdered and being captured by the FBI and CIA, Daryl swaps identities with Freddy but then discovers that his troubles are only just beginning. Directed by George Gallo. [S]
programme.title: Double Take

programme.desc: ...A Theory of Everything. Open Science. Are we on the verge of the holy grail of science, a single theory that explains what we are, and where we are going? [S]
programme.title: The Next Big Thing...

programme.desc: Open Science. How a broken cassette tape helped scientific sleuths track down a murder suspect, unravel an alibi and secure a conviction. [S]

programme.desc: Open Science. Bungee jumping with a fire hose rescued Bruce Willis from certain death in Die Hard, but would the stunt have worked in real life? [S]
programme.title: Hollywood Science: Die Hard

programme.desc: Open Advice. Being an OU student can teach important life skills such as time-management, organisation and both independent and group learning as well as the knowledge you gain. [S]
programme.title: A Different Way of Learning

programme.desc: Open Science. [U205] A look at medical consultations from both the doctor's and patients' perspective. [S]

programme.desc: Open Science. [SK220] What's the physiological basis for healing and what role do our emotions play in the process? [S]
programme.title: Healing the Whole

programme.desc: Open Science. Alternative health enthusiast Britt Ekland looks at the different cultural concepts of health, and Keith Floyd hunts down the truth about the healthy Mediterranean diet. [S]
programme.title: Ever Wondered?

programme.desc: Open Science. [K203] Dance, gardening, massage and magic. What's all this got to do with health? Everything, according to the Bromley-by-Bow Healthy Living Centre. [S]
programme.title: Healthy Living: Back to the Future

programme.desc: ...Figures in the Chalk. Open University. Aubrey Manning explores the history of the chalk landscape through thousands of years of human settlement. [AD,S]
programme.title: Landscape Mysteries...

programme.subtitle: Scotland v France
programme.desc: Jill Douglas is in Edinburgh to present top-class action from the Six Nations Championship. Scotland go into the match looking for their first victory over France at their Murrayfield home for a decade, but their confidence has been rising under new coach Frank Hadden. The French have been touted as pre-tournament favourites after showing signs of returning to their best form during their autumn Test series. Nick Mullins and Jonathan Davies are the commentators, kick-off at 3.00pm.
programme.title: Grandstand: Six Nations Championship

programme.desc: Coinciding with the Winter Olympics, the animal world stages its own spectacular contest. From the makers of the award-winning Animal Games, these new games set real animals against real human Winter Olympic champions. In a special effects extravaganza, animal behaviour is seamlessly blended with record-breaking human Olympic triumphs. Although this winter wonderland is created on computer, all the animals and landscapes are real and the human athletes have been taken from film of their actual gold-winning performances. Featuring animals from all the cold regions of the world and including skiing and tobogganing penguins, reindeer and wolves in a cross-country race and even a skating polar bear - this fact-filled Olympics is like no other. John Motson and Jonathan Pierce commentate "as live".
programme.title: Animal Winter Olympics

programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards meets some Unsung Heroes - extraordinary people of courage and faith, specially nominated by viewers and BBC local radio listeners. He hears the story of the man who has saved twelve lives and meets the family who've got a special surprise for their community. There's music from Matt Redman and Jon Christos and hymns from LSO St Luke's in East London. [S]
programme.title: Songs of Praise

programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team travel to Londonderry. Under scrutiny are the most intricately produced hand cut pictures, a cache of silver valued at over £100,000 and a cushion woven from human hair. [S]
programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.desc: National and international news from the BBC. [S]
programme.title: BBC News

programme.desc: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom. Followed by Weather. [S]
programme.title: BBC London News

programme.desc: The most powerful ability humans have is to master new skills. But how and why do we learn things? What stops us learning? And how can we train our brain to learn better?
programme.title: Child of Our Time

programme.desc: Now in her forties, Elizabeth makes one final fling for marriage - this time to the French Duke of Anjou, who is less than half her age. Meanwhile, Mary Queen of Scots - currently held captive in England - appears to be building allies across Catholic Europe. But Elizabeth's spymaster Francis Walsingham needs proof. After years of surveillance, he ensnares Mary in an elaborate sting to ensure she can be charged with plotting to assassinate the Queen. The trial sparks an international crisis. Elizabeth's advisors urge her to sign the death warrant, but she is all too aware of the terrible consequences. If Mary is executed, the Spanish are ready to exact bloody revenge by unleashing a massive Armada against England. [S]
programme.title: The Virgin Queen

programme.desc: National and international news from the BBC. [S]
programme.title: BBC News

programme.subtitle: Wanting the Wonder Drug
programme.desc: A new generation of life saving drugs is revolutionising the treatment of many cancers, but at a price the NHS cannot always afford. Panorama follows the women patients who decided to fight for the right for Herceptin, the new breast cancer ' wonder drug,' and asks - is the healthcare postcode lottery being replaced by who shouts loudest?
programme.title: Panorama

programme.desc: PC Wendy Coad has to deal with a shoplifter who as stolen a yoghurt from Marks and Spencers and is serenaded by Elvis Presley impersonators at Twickenham Railway Station. She also gets a glimpse of Tony Blair when she clears a station entrance for his arrival. PC Bob Gee and PC Dave Sanders have the task of finding a missing 14-year-old boy. The child, who is on holiday from Canada, is separated from his uncle while on the tube. Trainer Katie Kingston and probationer Mo Shah are called to an incident with an aggressive passenger on a train, and Mo attends his first one under at London Bridge Station. [S]
programme.title: Rail Cops

programme.desc: Johnny Cash sang with Elvis Presley in the 50s, Bob Dylan in the 60s and Bono in the 90s. He died in September 2003 shortly after completing the retrospective 'Unearthed', a 5 CD-set of the acoustic performances with which he resurrected his career in the last decade of his life, and after losing his wife and love of his life, June Carter Cash, in June 2003. This first major retrospective of Cash's life, times and music features contributions from his daughter Rosanne Cash and son John Carter Cash, his longtime manager Lou Robin and fellow musicians including Little Richard, Cowboy Jack Clement, Kris Kristofferson, Merle Haggard and Elvis Costello .Cash was the son of a poor sharecropper from Kingsland, Arkansas, who sang folk, spiritual and country songs to himself while picking cotton in the fields. In the 50s he signed to Sam Phillips' Sun Records, scored his first hits and was part of the 'Million Dollar Quartet' with Elvis, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins. In the 60s he created his famous 'Man in Black' persona, and became a huge country star with hits like 'Folsom Prison Blues', 'Ring of Fire', 'I Walk the Line' and 'A Boy Named Sue' while torn between drug dependency, hellraising and a powerful spirituality. Cash had long since established himself as a man of the people with his prison concerts beginning with an incendiary performance in San Quentin in 1958. He ended the decade by finally marrying June Carter, daughter of the legendary Carter Family who helped invent American country music, launching his own national TV series from Nashville, duetting with Bob Dylan, befriending the Native American movement and opposing the war in Vietnam while playing concerts for the soldiers in the field. [AD,S]
programme.title: Johnny Cash: the Last Great American...

Although this winter wonderland is created on computer, all the animals and landscapes are real and the human athletes have been taken from film of their actual gold-winning performances. programme.desc: Now in her forties, Elizabeth makes one final fling for marriage - this time to the French Duke of Anjou, who is less than half her age. Meanwhile, Mary Queen of Scots - currently held captive in England - appears to be building allies across Catholic Europe. But Elizabeth's spymaster Francis Walsingham needs proof. After years of surveillance, he ensnares Mary in an elaborate sting to ensure she can be charged with plotting to assassinate the Queen. The trial sparks an international crisis. Elizabeth's advisors urge her to sign the death warrant, but she is all too aware of the terrible consequences. She also gets a glimpse of Tony Blair when she clears a station entrance for his arrival. PC Bob Gee and PC Dave Sanders have the task of finding a missing 14-year-old boy. The child, who is on holiday from Canada, is separated from his uncle while on the tube. Trainer Katie Kingston and probationer Mo Shah are called to an incident with an aggressive passenger on a train, and Mo attends his first one under at London Bridge Station. [S]
programme.title: Rail Cops

programme.desc: Johnny Cash sang with Elvis Presley in the 50s, Bob Dylan in the 60s and Bono in the 90s. He died in September 2003 shortly after completing the retrospective 'Unearthed', a 5 CD-set of the acoustic performances with which he resurrected his career in the last decade of his life, and after losing his wife and love of his life, June Carter Cash, in June 2003. This first major retrospective of Cash's life, times and music features contributions from his daughter Rosanne Cash and son John Carter Cash, his longtime manager Lou Robin and fellow musicians including Little Richard, Cowboy Jack Clement, Kris Kristofferson, Merle Haggard and Elvis Costello .Cash was the son of a poor sharecropper from Kingsland, Arkansas, who sang folk, spiritual and country songs to himself while picking cotton in the fields. In the 50s he signed to Sam Phillips' Sun Records, scored his first hits and was part of the 'Million Dollar Quartet' with Elvis, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins. In the 60s he created his famous 'Man in Black' persona, and became a huge country star with hits like 'Folsom Prison Blues', 'Ring of Fire', 'I Walk the Line' and 'A Boy Named Sue' while torn between drug dependency, hellraising and a powerful spirituality. Cash had long since established himself as a man of the people with his prison concerts beginning with an incendiary performance in San Quentin in 1958. He ended the decade by finally marrying June Carter, daughter of the legendary Carter Family who helped invent American country music, launching his own national TV series from Nashville, duetting with Bob Dylan, befriending the Native American movement and opposing the war in Vietnam while playing concerts for the soldiers in the field. [AD,S]
programme.title: Johnny Cash: the Last Great American...

programme.desc: On May 13, 1939, the luxury liner S.S. "St. Louis" leaves from Hamburg for Cuba carrying 937 Jewish refugees in search of a new life. The past horrors are temporarily forgotten as the passengers become acquainted on board the ship, but their joy is halted when they are refused entry to Cuba and become virtual prisoners on a floating jail. Directed by Stuart Rosenberg. [S]
programme.title: Voyage of the Damned

programme.subtitle: Stalking the Jaguar
programme.desc: The Jaguar is South America's most mysterious predator - so secretive that even the scientists who study them can expect only a handful of sightings in a lifetime of research. Filming jaguars in the wild will be the greatest challenge yet for Big Cat specialists Owen Newman and Amanda Barrett. Equipped with amphibious buggies they head for Brazil's Pantanal, the world's biggest wetland, where jaguars feast on Caiman, Peccaries, Capybara and occasionally cattle. Deep in the wilderness, as the cameras begin to reveal remarkable new behaviour, the film makers start to wonder just who is stalking whom.
programme.title: Natural World

programme.desc: In this final part of the series, journalist, editor of The Spectator and MP Boris Johnson travels to Ephesus, Istanbul, Rome, France and Germany to see how the Roman Empire fostered a sense of common identity amongst its 50 - 100 million people. programme.title: Boris Johnson and the Dream of Rome

programme.desc: The story of an attempt to create the world's largest artificial island. With oil reserves running out, the small but wealthy Arab state of Dubai needed an alternative source of income - and tourism seems the ideal choice. The Crown Prince planned to get round his country's limited space by building an island to serve as a luxury resort. However, the project had to be built within two years out of entirely natural materials, while being able to survive the fierce weather conditions of the Arabian Gulf.
programme.title: Megastructures

programme.desc: Donal MacIntyre investigates the white supremacist music industry, discovering how far-right groups use record sales to fund their activities and as a recruitment tool - with CDs often handed out to schoolchildren. He also examines the activities of American Neo-Nazi movement the National Alliance, which produces a range of racist albums and video games. Featuring footage of a gig by right-wing band Whitelaw that has to be broken up by riot police.
programme.title: Nazi Hate Rock: A MacIntyre Investigation

programme.desc: Discussion of laws governing racial hatred, exploring issues raised by the preceding programme, including freedom of speech, the globalisation of extreme right-wing politics and how some bands are funding racism.

programme.subtitle: Einstein's Equation of Life and Death
programme.desc: It is the most famous equation of them all and it made Albert Einstein the most celebrated scientist in history. It explains things of sheer wonder - like why the sun shines and how, after Big Bang, the universe was created. But it also underpins the most destructive force ever unleashed on the planet - the nuclear bomb. This documentary with dramatised elements tells the story of how his most famous discovery, E=MC², went from being a mere set of symbols in a notebook to a weapon of mass destruction. It was something that so haunted Einstein, a lifelong pacifist, that he would describe his involvement in the bomb as his 'biggest blunder'.
programme.title: Horizon

programme.subtitle: Einstein's Equation of Life and Death
programme.desc: It is the most famous equation of them all and it made Albert Einstein the most celebrated scientist in history. It explains things of sheer wonder - like why the sun shines and how, after Big Bang, the universe was created. But it also underpins the most destructive force ever unleashed on the planet - the nuclear bomb. This documentary with dramatised elements tells the story of how his most famous discovery, E=MC², went from being a mere set of symbols in a notebook to a weapon of mass destruction. It was something that so haunted Einstein, a lifelong pacifist, that he would describe his involvement in the bomb as his 'biggest blunder'.
programme.title: Horizon

programme.desc: The third programme in the intimate epic series of Chinatown goes behind the takeaway counter to tell the story of two generations of Chinese people living in England - the parents who came from China in the 50s, 60s and 70s and worked long arduous hours in the takeaways to support their families - and their children, who grew up helping their overworked parents in the shops and now bear the burden of enormous expectations as a result of the sacrifices their parents made for them.
programme.title: Chinatown

programme.desc: Egyptologist Vassil Dobrev investigates the story surrounding the creation of the oldest free-standing stone statue on Earth. He gleans clues from across the sands of Egypt to the vaults of the Louvre in Paris, uncovering evidence pointing to the mastermind behind the powerful icon. Sculptor Glynn Williams constructs a scaled-down model of the Sphinx using the tools available in ancient times.
programme.title: Secrets of the Sphinx: Revealed

programme.desc: Concluding chapter of Francis Ford Coppola's grand gangster epic starring Al Pacino as Michael Corleone, now an ageing businessman trying to put his criminal days behind him. With Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Andy Garcia, Bridget Fonda.

programme.desc: The Revd Pat Robson is due in court on a speeding charge, while Matt and Alison face a dilemma over their future together. Boscastle begins an exciting new project to revitalise the harbour.

programme.desc: The beautiful church at Orchardleigh has become a favourite destination for couples getting married. But a new vicar is determined to reduce the number of weddings. Has the church become just the ultimate wedding accessory, or are the weddings bringing people back to God?
programme.title: A Passion for Churches

programme.subtitle: Big Sky Bears
programme.desc: It's Spring in Montana's Rocky Mountains and a Black Bear has just given birth to two tiny cubs. It will take all mother bear's skill, and plenty of luck, if the twins are to survive the summer and learn to fend for themselves.
programme.title: Natural World

programme.desc: Formby in Merseyside is one of the last remaining strongholds for red squirrels. Their demise over the last century has been rapid, in contrast to the rise of the grey squirrel. The programme reveals how and why Formby has remained a home for our native squirrel at a time when grey squirrels now outnumber reds by more than 60 to one. [S]
programme.title: Secret Squirrels

programme.desc: Jane Horrocks' family history is rooted in Lancashire; three generations lived in the same street in Rawtenstall and her ancestors form part of the town's cotton weaving heritage.
